results.title: L'amour Nu = Naked Love
results.creator_credit: Adolphe Viezzi, Henri Lassa and Yannick Bellon
results.brief_description:
Claire, a UNESCO interpreter, meets Simon, an oceanographer at an international conference. They fall in love and contemplate life together, but Claire finds a suspicious lump in her breast. After a few trips to the doctor, she finds out that she needs a mastectomy. Unable to announce the truth to her new boyfriend, she breaks off their relationship.

Credits: Producers, Henri Lassa, Adolphe Viezzi ; director, Yannick Bellon ; writers, Yannick Bellon, Francoise Prevost ; photography, Jean Charvein ; music, Richard de Bordeaux.
Cast: Marlene Jobert, Jean-Michel Folon, Zoriza Lozic, Georges Rouquier, Hyppolite Girardot.

results.title: Clerambard
results.brief_description:
Clerambard lives on the edge of poverty in an old castle. He ekes a living out of killing cats and dogs and exploiting his family. His life is turned updside down after reading ‘The life of St Fancis of Assissi’. The Saint even appears to help Clerambard go out into the world to preach the gospel and reveal his newfound love of animals.

Credits: Producers, Yves Robert, Alain Poire ; director, Yves Robert ; writers, Jean-Loup Dabadie, Yves Robert ; photography, Rene Mathelin ; music, Vladimir Cosma.
Cast: Philippe Noiret, Dany Carrel, Lise Delamare, Gerard Lartigau, Claude Pieplu, Roger Carel, Martine Sarcey.

results.title: fin du jour
results.creator_credit: Filmsonar a Epinay, Regina Film and Julien Duvivier
results.brief_description:
This comedy peeks in at the lives and relationships between elderly thespians living in an actors’ retirement home. The home is almost bankrupt and so the actors must support themselves. The residents include a faded sex symbol, an intellectual actor who kept a great distance between himself and the audience, and a depressed thespian who tries to conceal the fact that he was only an understudy.

Credits: Director, Julien Duvivier ; writers, Charles Spaak, Julien Duvivier ; photography, Christian Matras ; music, Maurice Jaubert ; art direction, Jacques Krauss.
Cast: Louis Jouvet, Michel Simon, Madeleine Ozeray, Victor Francen, Gabrielle Dorziat, Sylvie.

results.title: L'ironie du Sort = Irony of Chance
results.brief_description:
Set in Nantes, during the German Occupation, the film examines a series of events and shows what might have happened if one thing had gone differently in each instance. The main protagonists are two friends, Antoine and Jean, both in love with Marie-Anne, and both actively involved with the Resistance.

Credits: Producer, Christine Gouze-Renal ; director, Edouard Molinaro ; writers, Edouard Molinaro, Paul Guimard, Pierre Kast ; photography, Alain Levent ; music, Jose Berghams.
Cast: Claude Rich, Pierre Clementi, Marie-Helene Breillat, Jacques Spiesser, Jean Desailly

results.title: Le Passager de la Pluie = Passengers of the Rain
results.brief_description:
Melie kills the stalker who assaulted and raped her and then disposes of the body. When the body is recovered, Dobbs, an American military officer accuses Melie of the murder and of stealing the US Army money that the rapist had been carrying with him. Awards: Golden Globe 1971 for Best Foreign Film.

Credits: Producer, Serge Silberman ; director, Rene Clement ; writers, Sebastien Japrisot, Lorenzo Ventavoli ; photography, Andreas Winding ; music, Francis Lai.
Cast: Marlene Jobert, Charles Bronson, Annie Cordy, Jean Gaven, Gabriele Tinti, Jean Piat, Jill Ireland, Corrine Marchand.

results.title: In cold blood
results.brief_description: Truman Capote’s account of the slaughter of a Kansas farming family by two violent drifters has been transformed into a chilling and brutal examination of the nature of violence by director Richard Brooks. The almost paradaisical black and white cinemtography seduces the viewer who is then confronted by the horrific reality of psychotic murder. “In Cold Blood”, as does Capote in his novel, refuses easy moralising, simple sociological explanations and resists turning the material into melodrama or conforming to the dictates of the gangster genre. Edited with sharp precision, this film shocked American viewers on its release by revealing the sadism and ugliness underneath the frontier myth of rural America. Music by Quincy Jones. Starring Robert Blake.

results.title: Le Pont du Nord = North Bridge
results.creator_credit: Jean-Pierre Mahot, Barbet Schroeder and Jacques Rivette
results.brief_description:
Marie, a former terrorist, is fresh out of prison. She hopes to link up again with her former life. She contacts Julien, her former boyfriend, who does not seem too happy to see her again. When Julien mysteriously disappears, Marie goes looking for him. Here starts a surreal walk through the streets of Paris with a street map that looks like a board game and which Marie meets a dreamy homeless man, a small-time crook and destiny.

Credits: Producers, Barbet Schroeder, Jean-Pierre Mahot ; director, Jacques Rivette ; writers, Jerome Prieur, Bulle Ogier, Pascale Ogier, Jacques Rivette, Suzanne Schiffman ; photography, William Lubtchansky, Caroline Champetier ; music, Astor Piazzo
Cast: Bulle Ogier, Pascale Ogier, Pierre Clementi, Jean-Francois Stevenin, Benjamin Baltimore.

results.title: The Best years of our lives
results.creator_credit: William Wyler, Samuel Goldwyn and Samuel Goldwyn Productions
results.brief_description: Selected by the Library of Congress as one of the most important films of all time, this multi-Oscar winning classic recounts the problems faced by three veterans returning home after World War II, as they attempt to pick up the threads of their civilian lives. Fine performances by Fredric March, Dana Andrews and real-life amputee Harold Russell, and sensitive direction from William Wyler help to make “The Best years of our lives” an unforgettable film experience.

results.title: Un Enfant Dans la Foule = a Child in the Crowd
results.brief_description:
In 1937, Paul is a boarder in a religious institution. He suffers greatly from being separated from his mother and lets his school grades slip. During the Occupation, he becomes the pet of German soldiers, running errands for them. Later, he helps the Resistance, and when the Americans come to stay, he is really in his element with them. The films chronicles Paul’s attempts to fit in and connect with an authority figure.

Credits: Producer, Philippe Dussart ; director, Gerard Blain ; writers, Gerard Blain, Michel Perez ; photography, Emmanuel Machuel ; music, Jean Schwarz.
Cast: Jean-Francois Cimino, Cesar Chauveau, Annie Kovacs, Claire Treille, Jean Bertal.

results.title: La Vie de Famille
results.brief_description:
Emmanuel lives with his second wife, Mara, and her 20 year old daughter, Natacha. The relationship between Emmanuel and his step-daughter are tense, and an argument erupts just when Emmanuel is about to go and join his first wife, Lili and his young daughter Elise for the week-end. Emmanuel and Elise take a trip from the south of France into Spain, working on a film project. Through a series of round-about conversations, Emmanuel manages to open up a few channels of communication with Elise — channels that expand even wider when he uses the technique of talking into her video camera to express thoughts and feelings that otherwise would have remained hidden.

Credits: Producer, Jean-Francois Lepetit ; director, Jacques Doillon ; writers, Jacques Doillon, Jean-Francois Goyet ; photography, Michel Carre.
Cast: Sami Frey, Mara Goyet, Juliet Berto, Juliette Binoche, Aina Walle.
